Reviews.Title: “Nice place to be”
Reviews.Author: Ion386
Reviews.Content: They hotel it's ok. At might we can hear the neighbor but it's ok after a day walking fall sleep very fast. The staff are awesome. Inside parking for 6$ just two block away and free shuttle bring you at TD Garden in 7 min. 5 minutes of walk and You can visit the USS Consitution witch is 200 hundred years old navy boat all that for free. Enjoy Boston

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for a bargain”
Reviews.Author: JavyMedina
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as expected. This is about a 2 start hotel with the bear necesities. Just a place to spend the night after a long day of sightseeing. The price was just right. The front desk was attentive and polite. They where helpful in making recommendations as to where to go to visit and where to eat. Overall the experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “What a mess”
Reviews.Author: Amy R
Reviews.Content: Holy crap this place was pretty awful. The rooms were run down and the fixtures ancient. It was inexpensive but honestly for the price I wouldn't have expected a little more. The pictures on the website are deceptive, the only reason there's a huge pool and gym is because it shares the property with the YMCA. We walked past several times looking for the hotel before we realized this. The worst part was the noise. People were running up and down the street yelling and screaming literally all night long. Complaining to the staff didn't do anything. In the morning I asked for a later check out because I wasn't able to fall asleep until five in the morning and they said no, saying to many people were checking out (?) but when we got to the lobby no one was there. If the rooms had just been bad I could have handled it but the staff was awful and we didn't get any sleep. Ugh. Terrible, would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump.”
Reviews.Author: sandra_2360
Reviews.Content: We were initially assigned to a top floor with a sloped ceiling. Since we're both very tall we requested a change. The second room was not the best, but better. After dropping our bags off we took the shuttle downtown for a bite to eat. Upon returning and getting ready for bed, I notice that the sheets had hair on them. Upon further examination there was also pubic hair on the sheets. I called the front desk to complain and the matter was immediately addressed, but the fact that I had to deal with this was horrible. Later that night the latch on the toilet broke. We had to open the top and pull the chain to flush it. We decided to wait till morning to report it because we already felt like we were trouble makers. We did so lst thing the next morning and it turned into a nightmare. The maintenance worker was late to work and when he did come he told the front desk it would be another hour. I was later told that he had to go and buy a part to fix it. To be fair we were offered another room (dingy and facing a brick wall) which we declined and offered an additional nights stay for free. Honestly, I wouldn't stay there again if it were free for a month. The place needs a major upgrade and little things like finger prints on the elevator walls made it feel dumpy and dirty. On top of that it's some kind of shelter/residence for families. I couldn't get the full story about this, but it was absoulutey the worst place I've stayed in my life. If we didn't have basketball tickets I would have checked out immediately. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SRichardR
Reviews.Content: Tipped off about this place by a friend who brings his family and, like me, wants a good jumping off point to see the sites and enjoy the city. Stayed with my wife and kids (10 and 12). The hotel is clean and has an incredible gym, an olympic sized heated in-door pool (with lifeguard) and a full-court basketball facility. Basketballs, towels, etc. are provided upon request. There is a shower and locker room off of the gym and pool. Hotel has plenty of hot water, maid service, clean towels, sheets and a fridge and microwave (and TV) in the room. Some rooms have kitchenettes if desired at no extra charge. You can't beat this deal in Boston! As for location, it is in the Navy yard area, which is very safe.We found two good places for breakfast within a block and there is FREE bus service right to and from North Station every 15 minutes! No, there is no bar. No, there is no "room service". We come to Boston to see Boston, not to spend an inordinate amount of time in the hotel. This meets or exceeds expectations and is recommended for families or travelers on a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DanR2
Reviews.Content: We were happy staying here. Clean and comfortable. Interesting area. It does look a little tired in places, but remember it's the YMCA, not a 5 star hotel. All the stuff that mattered was fine. We loved having a short walk to Bunker Hill and the old warship Constitution. My only hesitation in staying here again with young kids is the lack of food (eg breakfast) at the hotel, and of kid friendly places for dinner, so we had to drive out for dinner each time.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, interesting location”
Reviews.Author: canth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for everyone. I rated it 4 stars because of the combination of price, features, location and decor. On the plus side, it's a block off the waterfront in Charlestown. For anyone wanting to spend time visiting the Constitution musem it's a no-brainer. The rooms have little kitchens including a refrigerator. The TV is just local Boston cable TV - no restrictive hotel systems. The top floors have skylights that can be popped open - in my case to several inches of snow. The staff was friendly and helpful and the parking was plentiful and free on the weekend. On the negative side, the decor is a bit old but the room was clean if a little drab. No hotel tax is a nice plus and makes the value hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “very unhappy”
Reviews.Author: stacy r
Reviews.Content: I had booked a hotel room for an overnight stay, I had to cancel this reservation. I cancelled in the alloted time to not get a cancelation charge. This wonderful place still charged my card and fought me tooth and nail to refund my money. When said refund was actually done the account was charged again instead of refunded. I found the manager not as helpful as one should be with a problem like this. I recieved no apology not nothing. I would never book a room at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre stay”
Reviews.Author: Urmi R
Reviews.Content: While a great location, the place is tired... carpeting is threadbare and just has an old "feel". The YMCA next door is nice for those who like working out... and of course, considering the area, the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mn2011_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to find that they had overbooked and did not have a room for us even though I had reservation information and confirmation number. This is unbelieveable because they have a 48 hour cancellation policy. Apparently they can cancel on the guests but the guests can't cancel on them. We did get a room for the second night of our stay. They advertise that there is a shuttle to MGH. Not so! There is a bus that stops about 3 blocks from the hotel & will take you to the hospital but that isn't a great deal when you have surgery at the hospital & then can not walk the 3 blocks back from the bus to the hotel. We had to call a cab & spend $15 to get back to the hotel. There is no parking at the hotel either. You have to park at a garage 2 blocks from the hotel. The neighborhood seems fairly safe but it still is a bit disturbing to have to walk back to the hotel from your car late at night on deserted city streets. Next time we have to go to Boston, we will spend more & get a decent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good location 'strange hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Andrew L
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the constitution inn for one night in a large school group i found that the hotel its self was in a great location however i was slightly miffed by the rooms large spacey but not pariculy clean in my opinion i would not return.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: korkybuz
Reviews.Content: The navy yards is a great location for boston, within walking distance of north station and north end or get the boat downtown. Rooms basic but fine, gym, pool and sauna an extra bonus. However we had a problem with keys not being recognized despite being reset, rather irritating, the rooms were also very warm and could not be cooled down with the thermostat, but these won't stop me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Boredsoxgirl23
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Great location, friendly staff and comfortable room. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: sharksrfriends
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a little odd. It certainly isn't what you expect from a hotel, at least. We booked through Expedia and the front desk woman took quite a while to find our reservation. No big deal, though. We had to wait a bit for the room to be ready, but that was a little expected since we were there pretty early, around 11AM. We came for a conference at the convention center, but we waited too long to book a hotel and everything close to the convention center that was even moderately affordable, was booked. This hotel served our purposes, though. It was a little far from everything we wanted to do -- convention center, downtown, etc. We were thrilled that there was a free shuttle just a few blocks away that took us to North Station to catch the T. Unfortunately, the shuttle only ran from 9AM-6PM on weekends and so was basically useless to us on the weekend. It was about a $8 cab ride to the T station. I will say that the women at the front desk were very helpful. Anytime we asked about the best way to get somewhere, they would give us fantastic directions to get there quickly and cheaply. The employees aren't what you would expect from a hotel in that they weren't all about customer service. I kind of liked that fact though - gave an authentic Boston experience. The room - basic and clean. It's old and nothing special, but if you're just looking for a clean and quiet place to sleep, you'll be satisfied. There was a fridge, coffee maker, and microwave, which was nice. The beds were clean and comfortable. Some people complained about there not being enough blankets. We noticed there was no bedspread on the bed and thought that was weird, but found two nice, thick blankets in the closet. The major downside was that our door didn't shut very well. We noticed multiple times that we had inadvertently left the door open a crack. I think that's certainly a security issue that should be addressed. Also, the pictures on this site are not that great of a representation of the room. It was a little darker and dingier than the pictures, but I suppose that's kind of expected. So, in summary: Clean and comfortable room, although old and minus many amenities. Location is a bit out there but convenient enough. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Beth T
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights recently with a Navy reunion group, so the location was great for the Navy Yard & related Navy stuff. The hotel was quiet, front desk staff very friendly & helpful, and I enjoyed the full "Y" in the hotel, especially the pool & water aerobics classes. Great rate!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Unprofessional staff--low priced and that is how you will be treated”
Reviews.Author: kaspar_kath
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Constitution Inn YMCA for one month. Not only were my colleagues given nicer, sleeker rooms with state-of-the-art facilities, but the maintenance staff and management did not put forth any effort to have anything fixed. They advertise having everything you need in the room for an extended stay, but there were no pots or pans. The flushing mechanism on my toilet broke. They sent up someone to fix it right away who explained that I needed to take the back off of the toilet every time I I had to use the facilities in my room so that the toilet would flush. I had someone look again after having to deal with this problem for one week. Also, I had a problem shutting my window (because the mechanism was broken). The response I got? "Don't open the window." Such a response does not work when you have a kitchenette in your room that will set off the smoke detector every time you cook unless you open the window. I was in the hotel during Tropical Storm Irene and I needed to study for the month-long intense class I was taking in Boston. The lights in the main shared living space don't work. I called the front desk. They sent up maintenance. The maintenance man flicked the light switch and started to walk down the hall. I called him back and said, "Hey! You flicked the light switch and nothing happened!" He gave me this look like he really was not interested and left. I called to speak with the managers about all of these instances several times. He (and she) never returned my phone calls. I was expecting less from the hotel because it is a YMCA, but I feel that living on the street would have been a nicer experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT just a WMCA, it is a pretty good hotel for a low budget!”
Reviews.Author: csantonja
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat dishearted by some poor comments on the webpage, and when we finally arrived we were nicely surprised: friendly staff, a huge room (yes, just the basic furniture, who needs more?), good air-conditioning... No noise from the expressway a hundred yards away, if you kept the window shut. There is no restaurant, so your meals need to be done somewhere else; we had more than enough for breakfast at a nearby coffe house (40 yards). We stayed over the weekend, so did not have to worry about parking, found a place just in the very same street. In all, a rather unexpensive, decent lodging for a family of four, sharing a room.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the expensive Boston, but many improvements can be made!”
Reviews.Author: Mllecoccinelle
Reviews.Content: I went to the Constitution Inn the busiest weekend of the year in North America: Labor Day weekend, so not lot of choice for accommodation in town. The Constitution Inn is not a very good place; but it's better than average. The location, in Charlestown, near Bunker Hill monument and USS Constitution is great, but you have to walk to find the subway (15minutes to North Station). You can use the MTBA ferry, (1,70$, but be careful, they don't accept Charlie Card) but there is only one destination: Quincy Market. The Hotel is clean, but finishes are poor. Shower was clean, but there were water leak and mold on the wall (hidden by wallpaper), so bad point for the bathroom. A good point: the mattress (always check the mattress) was clean and comfortable. The kitchen in every room is a very good idea for small budget or families, but you have to pay to have pan and dishes! It's a bad point, because you pay for a room with a kitchen, and you have to pay again to use it... Seriously??!! Staff is nice, you can put your luggage in a room before the check inn and after the check out to enjoy the day. My final mark is, Constitution Inn is Average + For what it is, I think it' a little bit expensive, BUT, for Boston it's not so much... (don't forget, Boston is more expensive than NY) To illustrate it: our room was at the same price as a Hostel's private room... It's a good deal, but many improvements can be made!

Reviews.Title: “was not impressed and will NOT be back”
Reviews.Author: Patty M
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a two night stay at the Constitution Inn in Boston/Charleston Ma... first off when I called to make my reservation I told them that I was seeking a military discount... they quoted me a price of $75 per night...they did not ask me what rank I was or weather I was active duty or retired... as it turns out I am the spouse of a retired E-6 Air Force man... when I got there they had only one of my rooms ready which was fine because we were early checking in but only half of my party was there anyway so it turned out okay... I took the room that was ready but when my daughter got there there seemed to be a problem with the rate... they asked me if there was a copy of my ID card on file and I said NO, they hadn't asked me for one and didn't take one...the woman looked at it and said "well this is the wrong price for you".... (I didn't give myself that quote) so she charged me the higher $99 per room per night... I didn't quibble... then we went to use the pool and they informed us that the pool was closed ... it closed at 6:00 PM and everyone had to be out by 5:45 PM...not good... when we booked the rooms we were not informed that if we wanted to use the pool we would have to cut our sight seeing short so we could be back on time...and then we were told that the pool would be open at 8:00AM the next day but the lifeguard never showed up all day so nobody was allowed to use the pool at all...we were told the pool would open at 6:00AM on the last day of our stay and then when we checked that morning were told not till 8:00.. but once again the lifeguard didn't show...he did get there but he was late in arriving...not impressed at all... 3 children were anxious to take a dip... THE ROOMS WERE ACTUALLY VERY NICELY FURNISHED AND THE BEDS WERE VERY COMFORTABLE...however there were no actual blankets on the beds only a bottom sheet and two top sheets and when I called the front desk to ask for one they told me that I'd have to come down and retrieve it from them...I was a bit taken aback by that but I went down and got it... then I was noticing that the heater/air conditioner vent was coming off the wall and the soap dish in the bathroom was also coming off the wall... there were large pieces of paint peeling from the door on one of our rooms...I had to wash out the ice bucket before I could use it for ice...it looked like someone with muddy fingers had stuck them inside and swished them around... I will say this much... the employees that I had contact with were all very polite and friendly but that's about all I can say good about this hotel... I would never recommend this hotel...I would pay more for the better services and amenities of a nicer hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: heatheral
Reviews.Content: this hotel seemed very nice before we got there. when we got there we were told the price was higher than the one they quoted us and that was not ok. the people were rude all except one girl whose name escapes me. the rooms are small and they didnt even bother to put blankets on the beds. the next day I took my 3 kids to the pool to take a dip before we left for the science museum and the life guard decided it was not in her best interest to show up that day. we waited for 40 minutes before they closed the pool and didnt even say sorry for the inconvienience. we are actually still here until tomorrow and i am just waiting for them to screw up my stay even more. the only ice machine in the entire place is on the second floor.and if you ask housekeeping for a blanket, they wont bring you one. they make you come get it. i am very displeased and will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Military Travel”
Reviews.Author: dearsarahlove
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Constitution Inn during our first trip to Boston. We received a great military discount, and saving money on the hotel meant more money to get out and see the city! Nothing fancy - rooms had a college dorm-like feel to them, but the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The only time we spent in the hotel was for sleep, so the lack of amenities was not an issue. A short and easily walkable distance to a pick-up and drop-off site for many of the touristy transportation (trolleys, duck boats, etc) if you plan to use these. Short walk to the water, but you cannot see the water from the rooms. Tavern on the Water is a nearby restaurant/bar that has good food and great service! The staff was very helpful and polite! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Jkramer14
Reviews.Content: The constitution inn was a nice place. The location was good, right near the ferry to long wharf. It's only $1.70 ea and brings you right downtown by the aquarium. Price was very good. Rooms were nice enough, nothing fancy but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room anyway. I did like that they had a mini fridge and microwave in the room. Beds were comfy, bathroom was a little bit small but clean. The biggest downfall was the elevator was sooooo slow. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but it's not easy to get to most places you might want to be”
Reviews.Author: sparewords
Reviews.Content: Our family just stayed at the Constitution Inn, and it was pluses and minuses. The pluses were the price (reasonable), the staff was hepful and friendly, the room was clean, the swimming pool (the Inn is connected with the Y was very good and so was the gym area, the parking was only $6 a day and the area was very quiet. Also, the ferry at the nearby pier (a half mile?) that goes to the aquarium was a bargain and a delight. The minuses were that the mattresses were in sad shape (worn out), the parking area is a bit tricky to find (a left-right-left-right away from the hotel), there's not much in the area and that it's tricky to get around if you are not familiar with the city. You could end up spening a lot on taxis. Overall, it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “pay the extra and stay in town”
Reviews.Author: outlaw37
Reviews.Content: Dirty filthy old rooms,hair balls all over on the bathroom floors,Maryann at the front desk was very rude,looked like hooker central the night we arrived,air conditioning barly worked,sounded like a daycare downstairs.Don't do it you will regret it it is a dump don't believe the pictures on the net!

Reviews.Title: “spartan and clean, but depressing atmosphere for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: goldsmanh
Reviews.Content: We needed 2 rooms and the price of this hotel was attractive (about 160/room/night total for us over $300/night.) compared to other Boston hotels. A little off the beaten track, but did OK with a bus shuttle to North Station. Rooms were very spartan, had the feeling of a college dorm. Lobby was undergoing renovation (I think)....no sofa, tv, coffee, etc. I was not surprised to learn that this was basically a YMCA. Although this was a completely furnished hotel room (TV, beds, kitchen area, coffee maker, full bathroom) this was in many ways like a hostel or bunk house. Cinder block wall, bad paint job, and I don;t think there were any decorations on the walls. It was a depressing atmosphere. After 1 night, we left for a King Suite at the near by Marriott Residence Inn and the whole atmosphere of our vacation changed for the better . Although I can not say anything in particular was wrong, I would not stay here again unless it was incredibly cheap. For the price we paid, over 300/night for 2 rooms, we were much better off at a real hotel in a 2 room suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....”
Reviews.Author: kriswasdf
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and free shuttle bus. Staff was very rudexcept Stephanie. You have to bring your own pots and pans. The express elevator is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Great location off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: thehiggi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in downtown Boston. It is across the harbor (less than $2 to take a water taxi across to the Aquarium/pier, kids under 12 free) in a quieter area, where one can easily walk to see the Constitution and access the Navy Yard. There is a small park for children to play just a 2 minute walk away that has a large sand area as well as playground equipment. There is a small cafe/deli in the immediate area as well for snacks, water, coffee and a fabulous quick breakfast/lunch. The Inn itself has two elevators, one for floors 1-3 and one for floors 1-6. The 1-3 was broken while we were there, but while the other was slow, it wasn't too inconvenient. The staff was wonderful and had a great rapport with the guests. The rooms were well appointed, including our 2 room suite, with 2 double beds and a fold out. We had a fridge, wine fridge, microwave, wet bar sink and 2 TVs. At some point, it would be good for them to upgrade these older model TVs, but they are adequate. Our family of 6 was comfortable in the suite (mom, dad, 4 kids under 7). Bathroom had full bath and shower, plenty of towels and excellent shampoo/conditioner/lotion/etc. The facilities were clean, and while it is definitely a 2-3* hotel, for the price (with a fabulous military discount) it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “much more than we expected in a positive way”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly7Ma
Reviews.Content: The constitution inn is part of ymca..the hotel has six floors rooms include refrigerators,microwaves, A/C,in room coffee/tea wireless acess. near area highlights, some within walking distance..plus there is a free shuttle at your use.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Mancio74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, rooms are big, location is a little bit too far from the center. In our room wifi was not working because too far from the antenna but at least the hotel provide the service for free

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Go Wrong for the Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: miss_martha627
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently took a trip to Boston with two other friends, and stayed at The Constitution Inn. Overall we enjoyed our stay. The hotel was a mere few minutes walk to the Charlestown Navy Shipyard where we could tour the USS Consitution (very cool experience) and catch the ferry over to Boston for $1.70 per person each way. Being connected to the YMCA and able to use the facility for free was a majoyr turn on for myself as I like to stay active while on vacation. The hotel was about to undergo some renovations in the lobby, but it never affected our dealings with the hotel. Our room was on the sixth floor and had a kitchenette which was great as we could purchase food at a nearby convenience store for breakfasts, etc. The bathroom did show a bit of wear, but the room was very clean (and cleaned daily), and when you only pay $100/night in Boston, I wasn't expecting standards of the Fairmont or Hilton. My biggest compaint would be in regards to the elevators: they were extremely slow (I'm talking a 5 minute wait at times). There is an "Express Elevator" for those staying on the 5th and 6th floors, but this elevator stopped at every floor on the way up and down, for people on the second floor to go to the third, etc. That was a little annoying as you would expect the Express to be quicker in getting you to the top floor. Aside from that, we were very pleased with the price, location, ammenities, and service provided. We will definately go back when we plan another Boston visit!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidAWooo
Reviews.Content: When I made my reservation I did not realise this hotel was run by the YMCA. That is no detriment to the value or the quality of rooms bearing in mind the room rate paid. While not feeling like a "professional" hotel - more a cooperative, its remains as no detriment - just different! Rooms were spotless clean, spacious, airy and well equiped with very comfortable beds. Discount car parking at $6 per 24 hours too! You have to smile! While some fittings fell off and needed repair - still no problem.. In the main a great place to stay and unbeatable value.

Reviews.Title: “Not a restful hotel”
Reviews.Author: HKMK90
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night...we realize the rate was reasonable but it was a very noisy hotel. Walls are paper thin... had to call front desk in the middle of the night because the group next door was so loud! Carpets in room were badly stained and the lobby was disgusting..wouldn't let my child sit on furniture. The location is great, walking distance to many attractions. But if you want a restful night sleep go elsewhere. Sorry for this review..we had hoped for a little better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Mark this as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: DrewKnightWV
Reviews.Content: I booked the Constitution Inn through Hotwire for a recent business trip to Boston -- when it appeared that many of the better-known (and better-reviewed) options in downtown Boston were booked up. I had never heard of the Constitution Inn before, and its Charlestown Navy Yard location was something of a mystery to me. Here's what you need to know: The Constitution Inn is a YMCA hotel, with all the rights and responsibilities that come with that brand. It is situated in the Charlestown Navy Yard, in a renovated warehouse-type building -- though the renovation was a cheap one, apparently done in the 80s, with very little upkeep since. My room was on the sixth floor, "in the eaves", with a funky roofline and a skylight window overlooking a dilapidated warehouse and the Tobin Bridge (maybe 200 feet away; constant hum of truck traffic all night, though not so loud as to wake you up -- once you wake up, though, it's hard to get back to sleep). The room itself was in rough shape -- it was a cheap build-out years ago, with industrial carpet, rubber base molding, cheap vinyl tile in the bathroom, and water damage all around the tub. The furnishings were basic, cheap dorm fixtures. In fact, the overall feeling of the place was that of a worn-out dormitory room. There were some pluses: my room had a full kitchenette, with an apartment-sized fridge and four-burner stove. A budget road-warrior could live here reasonably comfortably and cheaply for a week or more, if she absolutely had to. Being a full YMCA, there is a fitness facility in the building and included in your room rate. Street parking was easy (though the meters start at 8am, and Boston is notorious for ticketing), and the hotel has an arrangement with a garage a block away for $6 parking (no in-and-out)... easy parking in Boston can't be underestimated as a virtue. That's good, you will need your car... there aren't any great pedestrian or public transportation options if you need to get into the city (Boston proper and Cambridge are both a few minutes away by car -- but then you're dealing with parking again... good luck). There did appear to be some restaurant and cafe options in the Navy Yard a few steps away, and of course, there is the whole Old Ironsides museum -- well worth a visit, especially with kids. The Constitution Inn's mission is "affordable lodging in an historic location", and it fulfills on that front -- I paid about $100 including taxes through Hotwire. The easy parking and kitchenette options might appeal to a limited set of road-warriors who are in Boston for an extended stay and need their cars during the day. Otherwise, though, the worn-out physical plant and somewhat out-of-the-way location make this hotel hard to recommend, even if price is a top consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: scoozi_q
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Boston, we had just come from New York. We were on a trip that we were wanting to have a great time, but not spend too much money. Upon doing some research I found this place and it was a great deal! It is hidden in the Navy Yard area across the water from downtown, at first our cab driver had trouble finding it! When we were there we enjoyed it very much. It is nice and clean. Our room was HUGE. We had a fridge and microwave, 2 dressers, a table and chairs and a couch all in the room (coming from our little hotel in NYC we had no idea what to do with all the space!) It is attached to the YMCA so if you get a chance you can work out and use all the facilities for free which is nice. The Navy Yard around it is like little town all on its own, stone brick streets and a lot of culture. There are some amazing places to eat right around there and a 24 hour store with people who are so willing to help it is amazing! You can walk to downtown (about a 15-20 minute walk) or there is a FREE shuttle that leaves from right outside the hotel to downtown every half hour from 5 am till 6 pm which is super nice! We went to a Celtics game at the garden and walked home at night and it was just beautiful! For a great value and a nice place to stay, I would suggest this to people.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it appears to be..”
Reviews.Author: ronnyvous1
Reviews.Content: My son and I decided to take a short trip to Boston to see the sights for a day or so. After looking at numerous sites, we decided to give the Inn a try based upon price and location, since the USS Constitution was high on our list. The online listing showed a "recently renovated" hotel. This is a hotel in name only. You are staying at the YMCA, which shares the facility and the hotel is operated as a seperate entity. The place was freshly painted, but the old Y furnishings are still there. The room was a block walled dorm type room, very old, scarred furnishings replete with ancient cigarette burns on the nightstand, small bathroom, cheap mattresses, and so on. There was a small refrigerator microwave and coffeepot stacked up in one corner, you could use two of the three, we found that out after the coffeemaker wouldn't turn on, had to unplug the microwave to make coffee. The halls and room were both unbelievably hot, the outside temperature was in the upper 40's and low 50's. With the heat off and the windows open as far as they could (about 6") there was no relief, although they do provide a lovely oscillating tabletop fan. We propped that in a window to draw cool air in so we could sleep. Old, fuzzy 19" TV, although cable worked OK. Noisy place, as well, with the heat, noise, mattress and such, sleep was not easy for two exhaussted folks after a day of hiking around Boston. Torn skirting on the bed, institutional linens, old cheap carpets, 1950-60 era furnishings, this is not what comes to mind when one commands $125 and up for a hotel in off season, and not anywhere near the center of town. Location is great for the Navy Yard, and for Mass General visitors, and students, which composes a lot of the folks there. The Harbor Ferry leaves the Navy Yard, about a 10 minute walk, and drops you at Long Wharf in Boston for $1.70 a person, which is good for a day trip if you confine yourself to the center of town or plan to walk, take a tour bus, etc.. Parking at the Inn doesn't exist, there is metered parking on the street, but the Inn has an agreement with Mass Gen to use their lot at a discount, it is a 1/2 mile walk to the garage, for $6.00/24 hours make sure you get your ticket validated. There are one or two places to grab a snack nearby, no restaurants, diners or so on. There are few to no amenities, your key card allows you to use the shared pool and gym at the Y, nothing like a hotel facility, clean enough, but it is a public facility. The staff seems OK, upon checkout on Sunday morning my AARP rate wasn't applied, although I gave them the card when we arrived. There was no one on the desk that could make the computer authorize the price change, we ended up paying 'rack rate'. Overall, I fell that the online description of the Inn is greatly misleading. This is NOT anything on a par with what the average traveller thinks of as an Inn or Hotel, even on a Best Western/Days Inn level. We weren't expecting the Parker House, but this was a real disappointment. It is an old YMCA dorm, with some fresh paint sloshed on the walls, and a rudimentary set of amenities. I would bite the bullet and spend a little more to stay on the Boston side of the river, or search a little harder than we did and find something else. Make your visit to Boston something more enjoyable than being warehoused. It is cheap, to be sure, but it is no value even with Boston's high room rates!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy. Some small issues that can be fixed. Not for picky people”
Reviews.Author: capec0ddennis
Reviews.Content: My family - me, my wife and our 3.5 year old daughter had a one night stay. My daughter and I came up to Boston to pick up my wife, flying in to Logan. First - the hotel is only about 10 minutes to Logan Airport, that was very convenient. The location is really good. I love the Navy Yard, the street is pretty quiet. The bakery around the corner was excellent. Note there is no food at the Inn- you need to go out for everything. But all rooms (well, at least ours, and we didn't ask for it) come with a 'fridge and microwave. The rooms are nothing fancy at all. Our room had concrete walls, and worn carpets. But it was a good size. Same with the bathroom - good size. The shower head leaked and wouldn't stay still (it would constantly try to spray outside the shower). That was a pain. The bed was comfortable. The cooling didn't work well at all - we stayed in March, and had to keep the windows open, as it was so hot in the room. The rooms are under powered. There were two plugs that we could find, and both plugs had 4 things in them each - so we had to unplug something to be able to plug in phone and computer chargers. Not good. Please add a power strip at the least! One reason we chose the Constitution Inn was the pool. While waiting for my wife to arrive, my daughter and I went for a swim. We got in around 3:30. at 4PM on the dot, the lifeguard said family swim was over, and we had to get out. not cool. I found out later that since we were staying in the hotel, we didn't have to get out - family swim was over for YMCA members, not hotel guests. But the lifeguard didn't offer that info. I suggest strongly to management that they give all guests a simple one-sheet when they check in, lettting them know pool rules - like you don't have to get out when the lifeguard says family swim is over! By the time we found out we could have stayed, it was way to late. Its tough to have your 3.5 year old daughter, who was so looking forward to a swim, say "that swim was too short!" Towels. You would think they were on the endangered species list. There were no towels at the pool, so we brought ours down from our room. We asked for replacements from the front desk, but the woman there looked at me like I was speaking Greek. Maybe I caught her at a bad moment. The elevator (just one for floors 4-6), was terribly slow. We waited 8-10 minutes one time, 2-3 minutes the other times. I would have taken the stairs, but I couldn't find them. Free, easy to access WiFi was a treat. So many hotels still screw with guests when it comes to internet access. Overall - great location, inexpensive. Some issues, but we still had a fun night.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Actually Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: TheCrankyCanadian
Reviews.Content: My sister and I travelled to Boston in October 2010. We were on a budget so we were shocked to see that many of the hotels in the Boston city area were insanely expensive. However, after much research, we discovered The Constitution Inn and, to our delight, at $170 USD per night it was right in our price range. Itâ€™s also located in nearby Charlestown. Donâ€™t let the stories about Charlestown being the city that produces the most crooks and car thieves scare you; the naval yard where the hotel is located is pretty pleasant and quiet. Before booking at The Constitution Inn, you must understand and accept the fact that this is a very no-frills hotel. There is no room service, no mini-bar, no pubs, no restaurant, no continental breakfast, no bell-hops and no bells and whistles whatsoever. Donâ€™t go on a honeymoon here. Donâ€™t use this place as a romantic get-away. Donâ€™t put the VIPs of your company in this place. It's not a hostel or anything but it's very simple so if you're a fussy traveler who likes to be pampered, this place isnâ€™t for you. First of all, if you aren't used to driving on the crazy streets of Boston, you'll find this place a little hard to find. We circled the damn thing for ages before I finally parked across a sidewalk and ran in to ask where the hell the parking lot was. As it turns out, there is none. You have to park in a parking garage which is about a five minute walk away so if you have lots of luggage or are with people who can't walk far, you might want to drop them off first before you park. It's a paid garage but if you bring your ticket to the front desk, they stamp it and you get discounted or free parking. As well, the trek from the garage to the hotel is along some pretty dark back alley ways but since everything in the vicinity is pretty much deserted and/or boarded up, it's safe enough. It just looks scary. The old lady at the front desk is a bit crusty when you first speak to her but we were very polite and she warmed up considerably. She was also pretty helpful with directions and check in and out was quick and easy. The rooms were small but they were pretty good. The beds were clean and comfortable and bathroom, although a bit old-fashioned, was very clean. I'm picky as hell about these things and I was more than satisfied. The walls had a few scuffs and the carpets were a little dingy but on the whole, it was good. You also get free wireless internet, which was a big bonus for my sister and I. I read a few other reviews where people commented on the noise. First of all, ignore the ranters. Granted, the rooms aren't sound-proof booths so it was a bit noisy but it wasn't like sleeping on the runway of the airport or anything. We heard people in the halls but nothing from the surrounding rooms and even being light sleepers, we had no problems getting a good night sleep. As I said previously, there is no restaurant, continental breakfast or snack machines so you have to venture out to find sustenance. If you walk out the front door, across an empty lot and turn right, you will find a cute little deli. They have great breakfast, coffee, salads, sandwiches and the best pecan cheesecake I have ever had...although the owners have very thick accents and I thought he was offering me bacon cheesecake, which kinda grossed me out a bit. Since my sister and I don't like big, heavy greasy meals, this place was perfect for us. If you do like a little more "meat and potatoes" or you like snazzier digs, you are within a short walking distance of about half a dozen restaurants and pubs. Unfortunately, no nightlife within walking distance though. Boooo! The location of this place is amazing!! It is on an old navy base so you are a ten minute walk from the USS Constitution. We also did the Hop on/Hop off trolley tour and the first stop is the USS Constitution so it was nowhere to go to get on the trolley that would take you all over the city. So convenient!! We only had to take a cab twice and it was pretty cheap. Iâ€™m definitely staying at this place when I go to Boston again. Itâ€™s a great value compared to other hotels in the Boston area and itâ€™s a great location. As long as youâ€™re not expecting The Ritz, Iâ€™d highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brit2011
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Constituion Inn for New Years and would recommend this hotel to any of our friends! The room was clean and spacious. The staff was welcoming and was able to make recommendations on local restaurants and attractions as well. There is a ferry about a half a mile away that brings you in the heart of Boston which is also very scenic.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sloos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Constitution Inn a couple of times and both times were great. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel is in a nice area and it was only a $10 cab ride to Quincy Market. It's inexpensive and perfect for a night away.

Reviews.Title: “inexpensive, clean, and minutes from the city”
Reviews.Author: zeppelindude
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last New Years Eve and decided to come back for a second year. The hotel is nothing fancy, but it is clean, the beds are great, and the staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. The front desk was able to get us a cab excatly when we wanted on New Years Eve, no wait at all. The prices are great and it only costs $8-15 to take a cab to downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ikorel
Reviews.Content: Shabby, old dirty and expensive, No food on site except a few vending machines, little to no choice of food in the surrounding area, staff are friendly enough, room cleaning leaves a lot to be desired, free internet access, is about the only good point

Reviews.Title: “overpriced boston”
Reviews.Author: sirmiff
Reviews.Content: The Constitution Inn is probably one of the best value for money lodging possibilities in very overpriced Boston, MA. What you get for half a price of usual mid-range hotels in this city is a spacious, rather clean room with tv, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Even though there aren't many dinning possibilities in the area, the location is rather good - 5min walking to ferry which takes you downtown, 25min walking to the downtown. The Inn features a swimming pool and fitness area. To access the BOS airport take ferry and subway, or taxi (max 20USD).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Kurona84
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why people are so unhappy with this place. We stayed here for 3 nights. It was more than I expected for 100 a night. Rooms were cleaned daily, we had new soap, shampoo, and towels every day. The staff was pretty friendly. Parking isn't free, but it comes out to 6 dollars a day. Just be aware that the parking garage is about a block and a half away. (There is a spot to unload luggage in front of the hotel.) The hotel is in the Navy Yard, which is fairly secluded from the rest of the city, but I liked that better because it was less hectic. A cab ride downtown can be from 9-15 bucks depending on where you are going. There is also a free shuttle that takes you from the Navy Yard to the subway station (North Station). There is also a ferry that takes you from the Navy Yard to the downtown area for less than 2 bucks. I was very happy with everything and happy that I saved a ton of money staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Dump City”
Reviews.Author: Hockey_goon99
Reviews.Content: Got a pretty good rate for a hotel that is close to downtown in Boston. This place is a dump. It's the YMCA. Along with a collection of dirty, outdated, worn out rooms, there is a residence for long term guests. The elevators and traffic go through the place all day and night. We even had a 3am fire alarm to make the stay even more pleasant. The photos are not at all what you get with the Constitution Inn. Beware. If you want to save a few bucks in Boston, stay a little outside the city. This place just isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump this is...”
Reviews.Author: MTGMOBILE
Reviews.Content: It is not a real hotel but rather the YMCA - Didn't get the room we reserved 30 days in advance -Room was dirty - Reception was rude - Fire alarm by a bunch of drunk guests at 0300 was real nice, sort of teh iceing on teh cake. - I would not allow my dog to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY..Terrible Service..2 used soaps in the bathroom...WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN.”
Reviews.Author: Tourist10101035805
Reviews.Content: I had read the terrible reviews before hand and thought i could easily live with the dirty rooms and bad service but wow was i suprised at bad this hotel actually was. Rooms themselves were fithy, in my shower i had found 2 used soaps from the previous occupant. (they remained there for the rest of my trip). the walls and floor had dirt everywhere, very dusty, the bed table had burn marks all over it, the alarm clock didnt work, only 1 of the 4 numbers would show up. 6th floor and 4th floor WIFI did not work. The front desk service was awful. I was basically one step away from being completely ignored. there system was also down for hours, so nobody could check in. I never write reviews, but i was so discusted by my stay here, i had to take the time to tell you not to stay here, spend a few more dollars and go somewhere nicer. it left a sour taste in my mouth forsure.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfortable location, within easy reach of city”
Reviews.Author: JohnLetchworth_UK
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was really enjoyable. Boston hotels can be very expensive so this was a good price, The inn is in an old navy yard, there was little or no traffic, the room we had- two double room - was big and comfortable. There was a geat swimming pool and gym available. Cafe to have breakfast or mini-market are nearby. If you're quite active then it's a breeze into the city centre, ferry is about 5 min walk away which gets you to Long Wharf from where you can take the blue line at Aquarium or just walk for about 10 mins to Quincy Market. Alternatively, you can walk to North Station and TD garden - hockey and basketball - in less than half hour. It all seemd very safe, we walked back from there after late finishes at Fenway Park baseball games on Friday and Saturday nights. And of course, its very close get a look at the USS Constitution and museum. Get the 7 day Link pass for $15, you can use it on all the T lines, buses and the ferry, great value for moving about the city.

Reviews.Title: “If you want cleanliness and good service - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Traveller12398
Reviews.Content: Location: Although it is just across the river from downtown Boston, all transportation ends at 6 pm. It is too far to walk, so we had to take a cab the two nights we were in town. Also, there are only two options within walking distance for dinner. Hotel: Room we stayed in needed a good and thorough cleaning - it was given a daily once-over as they say, but lampshades were dusty, wall behind stove was greasy. They provide kitchen facilities, but no utensils, dishes or cooking pans. Front Desk: They don't provide you with an area map when they give you directions and the area is very confusing. The Constitution Inn provides a bed and that is about all, unless you count the coffee pot and coffee in the room. Not my idea of a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, easy access to sightseeing attractions”
Reviews.Author: caper2
Reviews.Content: Local YMCA...provides good clean accommodations without breaking the budget. Great location. Helpful and friendly front desk staff. Transportation to most sightseeing attractions is very close. Nice clean area to walk. Few restaurants in the neighborhood, but overall, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near Boston for savvy travelers”
Reviews.Author: efsch
Reviews.Content: Letâ€™s face it -- Boston is insanely expensive. If $300 downtown hotels get you down, consider the YMCAâ€™s Constitution Inn in the nearby Charlestown Navy Yards at about half that price. Rooms are simple but comfortable, with a microwave and refrigerator added to the usual hotel room amenities (coffee maker, iron, etc.) Couples should opt for two beds, since one double is a squeeze. There is no restaurant, but there is a small bakery under the arch diagonally across from the south lobby door. A Tedeschi mini-market with snacks and an extensive wine selection is one block west near the USS Constitution museum. The fitness center is free to Inn guests and is much, much larger than any hotel fitness center. It even includes a 25 meter indoor lap pool. Because there is only one entrance to the Navy Yards (at 5th Street and Chelsea Ave.), the Inn is free of traffic noise. I believe parking is free on the street over the week-end, but check details. Allow 20-30 minutes door-to-door to get to downtown. The BMTA ferry (Constitution wharf) and the BMTA #93 bus stop are each about 5-10 minutes walk from the Inn, and each takes about 15 minutes to downtown. Be aware that the outbound bus stops at Chelsea and 5th, but the inbound stops in front of the large brick church 100 yards northeast of there. Return #93 buses are easiest to catch at the Haymarket subway entrance in the north end. Bus and ferry service is quite limited on evenings and week-ends, so check the BMTA web site to make sure that their schedules fit yours before committing to this location (or use taxis to downtown for about $8 each way). A Logan airport taxi to the Inn should cost about $20 plus tip, but our taxi driver took us via the Ted Williams tunnel to increase his fare. Free airport shuttles outside baggage claim can take you to the blue line subway (shuttle #22) or to the Logan marina (shuttle #66) for the private (Roweâ€™s Transport, $10 to the Constitution marina) water taxis. I recommend buying a BMTA Link pass (just $15 for 7 days of unlimited bus, public ferry, and subway rides at the â€œTâ€� machine in baggage claim (use your credit card). We enjoyed our stay, and recommend the Constitution Inn for savvy travelers who know how to handle public transportation and enjoy value for money.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazingly Nice, Comfortable and Affordable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ArthurMiller007
Reviews.Content: We needed a get-a-way from the NYC summer heat and decided to escape to Boston. Without a car or friends/relatives in the Boston are, we needed something affordable as we were traveling on a limited budget. If this interests you read on: The least expensive hostel I could find online in a good area charged $40/night/per person PLUS (taxes, surcharges, etc.) For a family of four, that came close to $200/night just for a youth hostel. Then, while searching online, we chanced upon the Constitution Inn. Before I tell you about the hotel itself, let me tell you some background info: 1. It is located in the Charlestown area near the historic Navy Yard, a place most visitors never see. It is safe, beautiful and quiet. You are blocks away from the USS Constitution Museum and the most famous ship in naval history. 2. There is a mini-supermarket (commissary) opened 18 hours a day around the corner. 3. There is a free shuttle bus a block away ready to shuttle you from the hotel across the bridge to North Station. 4. The hotel has a YMCA fitness facility in the lobby that is FREE to guests that includes a 25 yard multi-lane pool, a fully equipped gym and sauna. Those facilities really made my day, as my gym in NYC closed a year ago, so I really got some good workouts in early morning and late evening. About the hotel: If you're looking for a four to five star hotel and are willing to pay 300 - upwards of $500 per night, stay away. If you're looking for a comfortable, clean place, are budget conscious, and not snooty, this is a wonderful place for you !!! No one will dote on you or leave chocolates on your pillow. But if you need anything the staff will surely assist you. (We asked for an extra cot at 10 at night and got it five minutes later.) Our room was large and comfortable with two double beds and had a small fridge and microwave. That helped us save money on breakfasts and night snacks. And since the hotel is officially a non-Profit organization, there is no tax added on, which can easily save an additional $100 on a four night stay. Veterans and family members are given special discounts, though no one in our group was a vet. You don't have to be a vet to qualify for a discount. AARP and AAA members also receive discounts. All in all, a very nice place that gives you the most bang for your buck. We enjoyed strolling out at night along the bay and piers If you prefer not to use the free shuttle bus that is intended mainly for staff and patients at Mass General Hospital, but open to everyone free of charge, there is a most scenic and sublime ferry ride ($1.70) from Pier 3 (a few blocks from the hotel) to the Long Wharf area near the Boston Aquarium. We will definitely be back and recommend the Constitution Inn to our friends. Arthur Miller, wife and two teens

Reviews.Title: “Great price for Boston and great location”
Reviews.Author: Meuledor
Reviews.Content: Great Price for a hotel so close to downtown. You can park your car near the hotel (2 minutes walk) for $6/day. Then you just have to take the ferry boat ($1.70) to go straight to downtown. Or you can take the Bus. The hotel isn't new and not really the best for romantic couple.But you will have access to all the YMCA features and the pool. And the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for military members and their families”
Reviews.Author: Am1088
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location in Boston-only a 10-15 minute walk into town. It was located right near the Constitution Navy yard where you could explore the USS Constitution, etc. The hotel was very welcoming to military and their dependents (me). The hotel was a bit on the older side, but the rooms were reasonably priced. The woman we spoke to at the front desk was very helpful when we asked her about how to get to places or what would be best to do in the time we had. The only problem with this hotel was parking. You either had to luck out and find a spot around the building, park at a meter, or park at the garage around the block that charged per 24 hours. If you are looking for a well priced hotel in a good location, this is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Constitution Inn, Boston Navy Yard, Boston,MA”
Reviews.Author: American_Travelr
Reviews.Content: Despite its appearances and its out of the way location it was a very nice and reasonable place to stay. It incorporates a YMCA gym and a lap pool. Its a 5 min walk to the USS Constitution and a 5-10 min walk to MTA water taxi to Downtown Boston at Long Wharf. Its also a short walk the The Tavern On the Water was a great place for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: vanmorrison2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 4th of July and paid 170 for the night (AAA rate). The hotel is part of the YMCA. I am not a picky traveler, but I was surprised how poor the accommodations are. To me, $170 is not cheap. I can handle a hotel with some age to it, but I expect my room to be clean and safe. Unfortunately, neither of those things applied here. The ladies at the check-in were friendly enough, but the lobby was a bit shabby. The hotel is a bit out of the way, and the shuttle was not running because of the holiday. It was only about $7 to get to North Station by taxi, so that was not too bad. Our room was on the 5th floor, and the room had not been thoroughly cleaned. I am not convinced that the bedding was changed. If so, they need to buy sheets that fit and learn how to properly make a bed. There was trash left in the nightstand drawer. The bathroom was pretty shabby. There was not any shampoo and only one bar of soap. The bathroom shower did not drain properly. The towels reeked of bleach. The air conditioning did not work properly but there was a fan on the table. We left for the fireworks, and because I heard another guest ask if someone had been in their room, I decided not to leave any valuables. When I returned, I did think someone had been in my duffel bag because they items were not as I had left them. That is a bit disconcerting. My biggest concern, however, occurred about 5:00 in the morning when the headboard fell off the bed and hit me in the head. Thank God, I do not sleep all the way at the end of the bed or else I really could have been seriously injured. I ended up with a nasty bump and quite a scare. The headboard was quite heavy and was basically just sitting on nails. The original screws had been stripped and someone had just put the headboard back on with nails. This was not sufficient for the weight of the board. My fear is that someone could get seriously injured with this. When I checked out, I mentioned this to the lady at the desk who replied, "Oh, yeah, we've had trouble with this and they've tried to fix it." Huh? There are setting themselves up for a major lawsuit and heaven forbid that it comes down a child. No refund and no discount, but, most disturbing, no apology or concern that I had been injured.

Reviews.Title: “staying here is a gamble- one I won't take again”
Reviews.Author: aismile
Reviews.Content: Pros of The Constitution Inn... price; location is nice, right by the Charlestown Navy Yard(we liked being in the quieter section of the city). Cons... this is a bare bones place, absolutely no extras, employees are pleasant but these are YMCA employees, not hotel/motel professionals. The first two rooms they put us in were awful- tiny and not at all what is pictured on the website, the furniture looked like old dormitory furniture. We asked about different rooms and they did move us to better rooms that were more spacious and had nicer furnishings. Still everything is a bit beat up- clean but worn. Beds were decent. I would not take the chance on staying here again. You will save $$ but I don't feel it was worth the savings.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Boston”
Reviews.Author: Militaryone
Reviews.Content: Great Price for a hotel so close to downtown. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs confirmed in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: sailorvenus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Constitution Inn for one night and woke up with bite marks all over my body. The hotel confirmed they had bed bugs. The bugs hitch-hiked home with me and now I owe $750 to an exterminator, which the hotel would not even consider helping out with.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HonsOnPatrol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my teenage son for a couple of days while the tall ships were in town. It's a nice walk from the hotel to the ferry that goes to Long Wharf (and the T), which was a pleasant start for our touring days (could be less so in winter). The hotel was quiet, well equipped, and all the staff I encountered were very pleasant. Having the fridge was handy, and there's a Store 24 a couple of blocks away that has most of what you'll need to stock it. I wouldn't mind staying here on business either. The wireless didn't seem fabulous, but it could have been me. There was also a computer and printer for guest use in the lobby. I wouldn't plan on doing serious work there, but great to print your boarding pass!

Reviews.Title: “Fairly shabby and not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: klrainer
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at how poor the accomodations were for the price of this hotel. We live on the South Shore of Boston and were in town for one evening for a wedding. The night staff were a bit unprofessional (very jokey and loudly horsing around with each other), but I was ready to dismiss that since I really just wanted to get into our room. When we got to our room I was pretty dismayed. Our sheets and comforter were rough and thin. The bathroom walls looked like they were rotting from the inside. After closing the bathroom door, you couldn't open it from the inside; someone in the room had to open it from the outside. The walls of the room were incredibly thin and we could hear what was going on in the room next to us. The television was out of focus and not watchable. We had a slanted window with no draperies and the blinds didn't work. I felt incredibly ripped-off and we ended up actually discussing whether we should just drive home at 3am rather than spend a lousy night in this hotel. It was not at all worth the price. That being said, I did find that the woman who checked us out the next morning was incredibly friendly and provided excellent customer service (as much as you can in the 5 minutes it takes to check someone out of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet part of Boston, not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2796
Reviews.Content: The Constitution Inn is in the Charlestown Navy Yard section of Boston. It is a quiet area to stay and easily accessible to the city by the ferry to Long Wharf. The USS Constitution and Museum are in easy walking distance as are the 24 hour store (great staff) and some eatting options. So overall a nice area to be in. The inn itself could use some work. The walls are very thin. I could hear the next door neighbors brushing their teeth and talking. The heat/air conditioning system cannot be adjusted. The entire inn is set to get either heat or a/c for a particular season. They were having a cool spell while we were visiting and the only option to freezing from the a/c was to have no air at all and use a blanket. But the a/c running on low was the only way to keep the noise down from the hall and neighbors. The bathroom had a very small sink and no vent. The staff was friendly and as helpful as they could be. While this hotel is at a good rate compared to the rest of Boston, you give up a lot of comfort to get it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value - stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Rochelle52
Reviews.Content: The Constitution Inn is part of the YMCA. The "inn" rooms are on the 6th floor of the building and longer term residents live on the floors below (the residents we met were all very nice). The room was ridiculously overpriced. The room was small, dark, and depressing. The bed was uncomfortably soft, and the threadbare comforter was stained and had cigarette burns. I wish we had stayed somewhere else, even if it cost more money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good facilities,convenient for Boston, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Visitor65London
Reviews.Content: Good value, good facilities (eg large YMCA pool/gym ), helpful and friendly staff. Our room on the 6th floor was plain but comfortable - the a/c didn't seem to function but this was no problem in April. Good for access to Boston - a free shuttle bus to the 'T' at North Station and a regular ferry (only $1.70) from a nearby wharf to Long Wharf next to Quincy Market. Excellent cheap cafeteria in Building 149 next door - apparently geared to hospital research staff but open to the public. A short walk to the Tavern on the Water - obviously dearer but great views across to Boston. Overall, a good recommendation for an affordable visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “what an awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: hilarysmith
Reviews.Content: What a great place. The service was great, the staff was very helpful and our stay all together was wonderful. We really loved being able to use the gym and pool while staying at the inn. Our location was perfect for touring the city and the greater Boston area. The room was perfect for our family, plus there was a stove and fridge so we did not have to spend the money on pricey restaurants we could just dine in. All i can say is we will be back and by the looks of it sooner than later. Thanks! The smith family

Reviews.Title: “We stay here several times a year .... love it !”
Reviews.Author: SLGMaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I discovered the Constitution Inn several years ago and do not stay any where else when we go to Boston - which is usually several times a year . This past August we stayed there with 6 other family members and as always the Constitution Inn did not disappoint . The people that work there are always pleasant and assisted us with taxi's , places to go and places to stay away from :) The rates are so reasonable and if you are a member of the military or retired , you get even better rates !!!! The rooms are clean & the ones we had had a kitchenette area - plenty of room . Remember to bring some cooking utensils - the hotel doesnt supply those .We take the water shuttle to Long Wharf and from there , you can go anywhere in the city. The shuttle even though is provided by Mass General is great-what a valuable resource to the community . We took it to North Station and again , from there the city is at your fingertips . I can't say enough good about the Constitution Inn and the staff that work there . Whenever we return , the staff remember us and you really couldn't ask for a better place, location and staff ! In fact , we are going for a birthday weekend for my husband at the end of March and we cant wait ! There have been some comments that the elevators are slow and there is no place to eat but we never had an issue waiting and there are some many great places to eat in and around Boston . Places near the hotel are Tavern on The Water - great views of the harbor and some wonderful margueritas ! Finagle Bagel will get you a quick fast bite and the shuttle picks you right across the street . There is also a conveinence store ( called 24/7 I think) that you can pick up supplies or get a hot buffet type quick meal and go back to the hotel . Parking is down the street and is discounted for hotel guests . Enjoy Boston !!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Boston”
Reviews.Author: CaseyGarden
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 rooms for 3 nights, direct by telephone from England after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Not able to book by email which was inconvenient and Hotel did not send confirmation by email either. Otherwise, an excellent stay. A handy location : near to USS Constitution and Museum, A short walk to the ferry to Boston harbour, next to the Aquarium for whale watching trip and just across the street from Quincy Market. Also, Hotel is just a short walk to the Old Town Trolley stop for an excellent tour of Boston. In the evening we went to the local hostelry ; The Tavern On The Water with great views across the water of Boston, especially at night. Great beer and Godo Food too. Rooms had refrigerator, mictowave and coffee making facilities but no breakfast available at the hotel. However, literally next door (across the street) there is a really nice self service cafeteria which is very reasonably priced. There is also a reasonable 24 - 7 convenience store just a 2 minute walk away. Rooms were a good size, clean and comfortable. In short, there is no need to pay high downtown Boston prices; this hotel is quite acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Transport + internet information”
Reviews.Author: drjbc
Reviews.Content: Besides being a short, quiet stroll from the historic ships and the north section of the Freedom Trail, the hotel's convenient for the ferry to Aquarium T station and the centre of town. That's a pleasure in itself: for $1.70 you get a succession of great views from the water. In fact we took that route when we left for the airport: ferry, subway, and free shuttle to the terminals. The only thing that went wrong during our stay was when we first arrived. Having made our way to North Station on the subway, we called the hotel to enquire about the shuttle we'd heard about. They told us where to pick it up and said it was 'white'. After an uncomfortable half hour waiting with our bags on a busy street corner, seeing dozens of white vehicles and asking some if they went to the hotel, we gave up and took a taxi cab ($7). Only afterwards a different receptionist told us it was a (free) Mass Hospital shuttle, going not to the hotel but to a nearby street. If you have a laptop then do take it. There's a good free wi-fi signal, but the one PC in the lobby always has people waiting to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: itlcherrypie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and simple. Staff was pleasant when we checked in. If you are just looking for a place to sleep, this is perfect. Price is fairly reasonable. It is a little out of the way from anything to do other than visit the USS Constitution. All Boston sites are a short drive. Parking garage is a little far from the hotel to walk at night with nothing else around and like the rest of Boston, finding parking on the street is very difficult. Kitchen area is cute, but plan on bringing pots and cooking utensils if you plan on cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Timbo302
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay. It was kinda out of the way and the only place to eat within walking distance was pricey and not a very good selection. The hot water heater went out so we had to take cold showers, but they discounted our room so it was nice. You can catch the ole time trolley just a short walk away by the USS Constitution ans ride it into Boston.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: kyderbymom
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a convenient place to stay in downtown Boston that was reasonably priced. Since my hubby is in the military, we got to stay here for $99 a night. Had we paid full price, I would have been much more upset, but for the cost, and the time we were actually in the room, it wasn't bad. That being said, the hotel is in a pretty deserted neighborhood. I would not have wanted to be walking around at night down here. It's in a former military dominated area, and there are/were a lot of warehouses, offices, etc. and not a lot of places open after hours. It's pretty empty in the evening, and I didn't really feel safe outside. The room was pretty basic. One wall was painted cinderblock. The beds were okay comfortable, but the spreads had had a few too many washings, and were old and faded. The carpet looked vacuumed, but I wondered when it was cleaned last and just had to put the thought out of my head when I walked on it. The room was pretty much clean, but it was just tired. We had two full-sized beds, a big closet, three drawers in the bottom of the tv wardrobe, and a table and two chairs. There was also a fridge and microwave. One poster mentioned the thin walls. I will second that! Thankfully, my three kids (12, 9, and 6) were asleep when the folks next door started getting busy. I could hear the bed squeaking for quite awhile before it was quiet. I thought about banging on the wall, but figured that would just postpone the inevitable. There were also some very noisy folks across the hall who had two rooms. Unfortunately, the rooms didn't connect, and they kept visiting back and forth until after midnight. The doors in the hotel close very loudly, and they'd shut their doors and then bang on their friend's door. I finally called the front desk before they got quiet. The hotel has a lot of young military people staying there who are on temporary duty at the Charlestown Navy Yard. Many of them are still in "party" mode, and having been young and military, I tried to give them a break. But they were loud. There is a YMCA that you can use when you stay here. The kids were excited to go swimming the first night of our stay. The guy in charge of the pool was, shall we say, "strict" about his pool. At 7 p.m. the pool still had lane lines up, and he allowed the kids to swim in about 1/3 of one lane line and got on them if they went past the chair. At about 8, he got out his CD player, and stretched the electric cord across the walkway (safety???), and put in a Roger Whittaker CD and turned it up so loudly, we had to shout to communicate. Then he played Broadway show tunes and Johnny Cash CDs. I got the feeling he was trying to get us out of the pool and was playing whatever he could to make us leave. We gave in about 8:30 and didn't go back for the rest of our stay. One of the good things about this place was that it was really close to the water taxi. It picked us up at the Charlestown Wharf and dropped us off at Long Wharf. It was a short ride, and only cost about $1.70 each way. There was also a free shuttle a couple of blocks away that took us to North Station so we could take the T wherever else we wanted to go. I will say that the front desk people weren't very friendly or helpful. I asked for help on how to get from the hotel to Lexington, and they gave me a map. I asked for more details, and they said I would have to go online because they couldn't help me. I would think that would be something a front desk person at a hotel would just know. Surely I'm not the first person to ask how to use the public transportation in Boston. Parking was another bonus. We got to park in the nearby garage for $6 a day. We could have parked on the street for free but were warned about possible vandalism to our cars overnight. Again, it was pretty deserted where I parked, so I was uncomfortable walking the three blocks back to the hotel, but I am here to write about it, so it worked out okay. I'd take a friend next time, though. All in all, we weren't in the room so much that it was a huge problem for what we paid. Would I stay here again? Probably not, but who knows? Maybe I'll be in the mood for some Gershwin one of these days!

Reviews.Title: “A good (basic) hotel”
Reviews.Author: yamhill
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Consitution Inn the first week in July and I have to say it was... even though lacking a few frills associated with the more posh accomodations to be had...still an enjoyable stay. A hotel in a navy yard might conjure up visions of noise, dirt, welding torches, riveters, etc...relax ..that's history. What I found were well preserved brick historic navy buildings and warehouses and such that are being transformed into condos and business offices. The neighborhood is quiet (very quiet compared to staying in downtown Boston)with light traffic. The front of the hotel is on a pedestrian street. With the waterfront closeby there are shoreline jogging trails and parks amid high rise condos and townhouses and marinas in a pleasant and safe upscale neighborhood of Charlestown. I confess that my impressions of this hotel are of a favorable bent because I am a history buff and because of this and the hotels location (the USS Constitution is moored just down the street) I probably overlooked one or two things that might raise one of those proverbial red flags to guests expecting more. This is a navy hotel and has a nautical feel to it with foot square brass plates with black engraved room numbers that looked like they were salvaged from the fleet. The staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby is small and unassuming. Next door is a YMCA. Guests get free access to the pool and excersize equipment. No restaurant. However there are a couple of eateries like the Tavern On The Water a stones throw away. .It was here I enjoyed a bowl of "chowdah", and a pint of Sam Adams while watching Old Ironsides fire a 21 gun salute on her annual Boston harbor cruise on the 4th. On the nation's birthday for a history guy like me it doesn't get much better. There is a bistro nearby, a Finegal A Bagel, and Store 24 (like a 7-11) and a B of A . A bit farther away (a 15 minute walk to the Bunker Hill Monument and the nearby Warren Tavern frequented by Paul Revere.) There is a 10 minute water shuttle...from the navy yard to downtown Boston a short walk from the hotel for a $1.85 each way. Next to the hotel is a Mass General Hospital with free bus transportation that runs hourly shuttles to and from the downtown Mass Gen Hospital ..stopping on its way at the North Subway station. Did I say it was a free shuttle? Oh yeah..baby.Not necessary to be brandishing a stethescope around your neck to ride...anyone can climb aboard. . One heck of a deal. Even if it didn't have wifi in the room, or what you'd call state of the art bathroom sinks....the bed was very comfortable, the air conditining, microwave, fridge, shower, head all worked...it was clean and comfortable...and unlike the cookie cutter lodging chains the place had a certain personality and character to it. Will I return to Boston someday. Maybe. Would I stay again at The Consitution Inn. Definately.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: sh10505
