Reviews.Content: As you know, i have a family of 5. One child and 4 adults. They did pretty well supplying us with the beds. We had 2 double beds and an extra 1 person bed. BUT in the bathroom there are only 3 towels. So i call the desk to bring some towels up, but their service is SO bad that you have to get them yourself. We also had a horrible view of the construction of dead buildings. And there is no place to park in front of the hotel except at a garage which is a few blocks away. When i asked how to get to the garage, they gave us directions but one of them at the end said to look for the MGH sign outside but we couldnt find it BECAUSE IT WAS INSIDE THE GARAGE(they don't really give great directions). That was after we went to ask them a second time for directions. But everything else was within reach, all the places we have been planning to go to weren't far away.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: gabriellet
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Boston for the first time because I was interested in attending Emerson College. However, my parents and I found (like with all cities) that all of the hotels in Boston were very expensive. We actually found Constitution Inn by using this website. The price was far cheaper and the reviews were good. I was very pleased with my experience there. For staying at the hotel, we got free parking. There were a few places to eat nearby (Finagle A Bagle, etc.) Traveling to the college was a breeze courtesy of the ferry and the shuttle bus was a nice accomodation. The people were very helpful and we all appreciated the view on the water, but most importantly, the quiet! Constitution Inn, like many others have said, is very much a hidden gem and I highly recommend it. No, it is not luxurious, but it is comfortable, a reasonable price, and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: LarchmontMargot
Reviews.Content: Had read the good reviews and booked the Constitution Inn for a one night stay. The location was fine. We visited the Museum and the ship (both worth a visit) and really enjoyed taking the shuttle to downtown Boston (coming back with the last shuttle at 8pm with Boston lights in the background was a real hit - amazing value for 1.70$!) We also had a nice dinner at the nearby bistro (with a discount for guest of the Constitution Inn). The room was decent enough for the price but good sleep was another story. We got a room with doors communicating to neighbours on each side. I can't really say whether it was because of the doors or paper-thin walls but we felt like if we were sleeping in a dorm - hearing our neighbours as if they were in our room. A couple on one side coughed and snored all night, on the other side a family with young children watched TV (after 11pm the staff did asked them to turn it down), talked so we could follow every bit of the conversation. We had a terrible night and even if the price is reasonable it is not worth it if you can't sleep. If you sleep lightly I advise you to check with desk if all rooms have communicating doors to neighbours. The staff was not overfriendly but we did get the information we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem, Quiet Location, Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: parkies
Reviews.Content: We booked this place based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were pleased we did. Don't get me wrong this place is not perfect but it is great value for money compared to other hotels this close to the city. We were a family with 2 kids, aged 7 and 11, staying at the beginning of April 2008. The room cost $139 per night sleeping the 4 of us in 2 queen beds which I have to say were not the most comfortable. Our only other problem was regulating the temperature in the room which has some kind of thermostat which made no difference when we turned it to cool. Leaving us no option but to leave the windows open. Fine in a very chilly April but not much use in summer nor very kind to the environment! However having said all that I would still recommend this place. It is very close to the USS Constitution as the hotel name suggests and the area is very quiet most of the time wih very little traffic noise (ask for a room on the Harour side of the hotel). Our room had a fridge and microwave and coffee maker wih free tea and coffee. Also iron and ironing board plus hairdryer in the bathroom. There is a nice local cafe (American Bakers Cafe) just down the street (through the archway) great for breakfast bagels etc also Finnagle A Bagel in the street across from that. Also a small Stop & Shop in the next block on the way to the USS Costitution for groceries etc. Travel to the city couldn't be easier or cheaper. There is a free bus which picks up in the next street ( ask at reception) goes every 15 minutes and takes you to at least North station maybe further. It is meant for staff and patients of the hospital but everyone uses it and the driver asks no questions . Just hop on. The other option is a wonderful 10 min boat ride (part of the "T" system) from Charlestown Navy Yard (approx 5min walk) to Long Wharf. Dropping you right by the New England Aquarium. Cost $1.70 each way . Kids free. Runs approx every half hour, more a peak times, less at weekends. Check timetable posted in shelter or pick up timetable once on board. These boat trips were one of the highlights of our trip. A wonderful way to approach the city each morning. We had 3 nights at this hotel at the beginning of our trip and the staff although initially seemed a liitle disinterested, were all very pleasant and helpful if you make the effort to engage them in conversation and kept our cases in the back room while we collected a car for the next part of our trip to Cape Cod. On our return we stayed the last 2 nights here( different room on the back -a little noisier) and the trip to the airport at 7.15am took approx 10 mins. All in all a good hotel and we would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mowzer
Reviews.Content: We were not quite sure what to expect with this accomodation when we arrived but it certainly exceeded our expectations. The location was perfect. It was actually better than being in central Boston as the views across the water are stunning and ferry ride each day is really special. We were jet lagged so one of our favourite memories of this accomodation was having an early morning stroll around the Quay - it is beautiful and so quiet. Few places nearby to pick up a hot chocolate or a good breakfast. Room itself was a good size with en-suite. It had everything we needed - only downside was the blind that we had to put up ourselves each day! You can walk into Boston itself from this hotel (about 20mins across the bridge) and its superbly located for the freedom trail. Internet access was a plus, as was the swimming pool! Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - not central though”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2007Sydney
Reviews.Content: 4 of us from Sydney Australia were travelling in Boston for 3 days in late July 2007 and we stayed at the Constituton Inn at US$239.00 per night. We highly recommend the Constitution Inn. The reception staff were not overley welcoming but they did their job okay and we were checked in and out without too much fuss. If you are taking a cab from the airport to the Consttution Inn be sure that your driver knows exactly where he is going (the Constituton Inn is kind of off the radar a little) - our driver didn't actually know where the Constitution Inn was and so we ended up getting a little lost but got there in the end after the driver called the Inn to get directions. The room we stayed in was nice, large and clean. It had an ensuite bathroom. The bathroom was nice and clean. The room faced onto one of the back streets in the Navy yard area and was very quiet. As the Inn is actually positioned inside the navy yard it is well away from the centre of the City. In fact, you need to take the ferry in order to get into the centre of the City. We loved taking the ferry every day. It is a beautiful 10 minute ferry trip. We had to call for toilet paper once because housekeeping didn't provide new toilet paper rolls but they brought up 2 rolls of extra toilet paper for us when we called so no big problem in the end :) The facilities at the Inn are great and include a laundry and a gym. There is also a 24 hour convenience store on the corner. We purchased a box of cerial, some plastic bowls and some milk and ate this for breakfast (there was a kitchen in our room with fridge and a small amount of cutlery). The other option for breakfast is the bagel place just 5 minutes walk away in the navy yard (Fenagle A Bagel ??). There is also a cafe in the navy yard too. Someone posted about the internet not being available - when we stayed here in July 2007 the internet was readily available in the lobby area and we had no problems with that. Despite the Constitution Inn being military accommodation, we did not see many military personnel - mainly wives and children of miltary personnel. TIP FOR LUNCH: the wharfside restaurant/tavern - its a big blue building with a stair case going up to the second floor - right on the marina near where the ferry leaves. Great service. Great location. Great steak (but unfortunately no steak knives?).

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: DeanRosalia
Reviews.Content: Government discount was nice. Hotel was clean. Staff not overly friendly but found that in other areas of Boston as well. Our rental car was broken into overnight however and it was one of several. Boston police officer that responded didn't even carry forms to fill out a report and was not interested to investigate the other cars damaged as well. Sorry Boston, but you are on our least favorite city and the low part of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, central -- couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Kanute
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice for the two of us on a little city tour of Boston. We had an end room on the fifth floor (512) with windows on two sides and, peaking through the old navy yard buildings, could even see a little bit of water. We took the 10 min ferry ($1.70) into the city each day -- great way to explore Boston and not be smack in the middle of the hustle and bustle. We made use of the 15% discount at the nearby Navy Yard Bistro. The food was absolutely extraordinary. I also used the YMCA gym (Constitution Inn is part of the Y), which was a fully-fledged gym with a huge pool. All in all, this is the place to stay if you want a clean, well-kept hotel in a quiet but central neighbourhood. Oh yes, parking was another great thing. The hotel discount at a parking garage 5 min away reduces the 24hr. charge from $25 to $6.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Global_Shell
Reviews.Content: Such a great deal on lodging! Simple rooms, looks like dorms, but worth the price. The rooms are spacious and clean. The walls are thin though. Several nights we were woken up by our amorous neighbors, a little embarrassing as we didn't want to participate in their romantic endeavors but what can you do? Housekeeping came every day, but does not wipe down counters apparently. No big deal. It's in a fabulous location, right next to the USS Constitution. It's a short 15 minute ferry ride to the North End or a 15 minute walk. There are tons of places to eat, the staff is friendly and helpful. The only real annoyance, other than the 'noise' is that the internet is not as available as advertised. The routers are on the 2nd and 4th floors so if your room is not there you'll need to go to the library/reading room on the 2nd floor and set up there. I could barely get a signal in my room on the 5th floor, I did get a bit with the door propped open if I was standing but it was easier to set up on the 2nd floor. I recommend this place, it has a gym, pool, and is convenient to downtown Boston. I also recommend getting the weekly T pass, it was only $15 for 7 days and that included the T, buses, and the harbor ferry from the Constitution Inn to the North End, and you can take that ferry to the North End, walk 1 minute to the blue line and use it for transportation to the airport! Only about 40 minutes travel time and way cheaper than a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Not Luxury, But Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Daytripper75
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay if you want a clean room at a reasonable price. My husband and I stayed here on June 11, 2007, and the room was clean and the king-sized bed was very comfortable. The desk clerks were very nice and suggested a restaurant for us when we arrived late in the evening. The next day, they kept our luggage while we saw the sights, then called us a cab for the airport. I would only caution that this is a converted YMCA and it is not luxury. It's not a dump, by any means, but if you want luxury you'll have to spend more and go elsewhere. That being said, the room we had was on the 6th (top) floor, and it had a dresser, small table and chair, and another more comfortable chair in the corner. There was a skylight and a small closet. The bathroom might be a problem for some. The sink was just that, a small pedestal sink with no counter space. There were shelves above the toilet that we put our toiletries on, so it wasn't a big deal to us. Also, the only mirror is the one over the sink. One thing I should mention is that we are average-sized people and the bathtub/shower seemed a little narrow to us. If someone a little larger used it, it might be a little tight. However, for people on a budget who can live without a few niceties and just want a clean room in a good location for the Freedom Trail, this one can't be beat. We went to see The Constitution first, then walked up to Bunker Hill and back down the Trail to the Commons, stopping to eat and rest along the way. We then took the ferry from the State St. pier back up to the one near the hotel. It was only a couple of blocks away. One more thing, as someone mentioned earlier, there is no food in this hotel. Nothing. We didn't even see vending machines. Another guest told us that we could get a cheap breakfast at the nearby hospital cafeteria. We did get a cheap breakfast ($9), but it wasn't the greatest. However, it did get us off and going much quicker than a regular restaurant would have, so it is something to consider if you're there to sight-see and want to save time. All in all, we would stay at the Constitution Inn again. We paid $162 AAA rate. We thought it was a very good deal in this high-priced town.

Reviews.Title: “the price is right!”
Reviews.Author: bostondic
Reviews.Content: i had contacted the constitution inn directly after finding the inn thru the internet. their pricing is based on your military rating, but also as a civilian your eligible to stay there. active duty assigned the uss constitution stay there. when we got to the inn, everything was in place. the staff was extremely courteous and very helpful on questions about boston touring in general. our room was probably one of the largest that i'v ever had. the room was clean, neat and ready. maybe the views are not the best in the world but down stairs, there is a full fittness center that includes a monster heated 50 yard swimming pool, large saunna, free weight room, fitness machine room, loocker rooms, full court gymnasium, a full laundry facility....the business license says armed forces ymca. they have a reading room with books and games... we spent our first two days of the week we had here and enjoyed ever minute...also our last day, three days at the inn... another good point on friday afternoon to monday morning.. its free parking. the inn is very easy to get to from the airport. boston has serious traffic congestion...forget the "big dig" we never had to go in it, the tours all leave from walking distance from the inn....in one short sentance....we loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: CAhound
Reviews.Content: The Const. Inn isn't for everyone; the level of comfort and service is below a typical Marriott, for instance - it's similar to a mid-level large hotel one might find in England. For the price, though, the room was large and clean, w/stove/oven/sink/micro, the fitness center was great (75 foot indoor lap pool, lockers, basketball court), and the location was fine using the T boat ferry (five minute ride) over to the Aquarium Station on the blue line. (The boat is covered on a $15.00 one-week pass - in four days we used $40.00 worth of boat/subway fares.) We did notice increased noise once a loud family moved next door (not during sleeping hours, though - we just lived with it). I'm not in the military, but didn't feel out of place. If I were staying again, I'd get a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor, as their elevator service is better, or even get a spot near the non-emergency staircase. We got local bagels every morning and toasted them in the room (get well-outfitted w/napkins and plastic utensils). At least for us, the fitness center supplied towels, too; we did get extra towels for the room when we asked, though. It helps to print a full schedule of all days for boat service, so you can plan your activities accordingly. If you end up in Boston after service has ended, the taxi ride home (maybe ten minutes) is a decent trade-off to avoid spending much more staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept Secret for The Military”
Reviews.Author: justin23
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. I live in Maine and love to travel to Boston. GO SOX!! Anyway very friendly and nice staff. Well worth the money! The king size beds are comfortable. Fridge and Stove located in the room, clean bathrooms and clean building. Why pay $140 when you could pay more and get a better room. Happy Enlisted

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: HAP1995
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminds me of my college days. It looks to be a commercialized Bachelor Quarters from the military days. Cheap furniture, average bed, and thin walls. If you compare the price you pay to the rest of Boston, it is on par for what one would expect. Our walls were paper thin. After coming back from dinner we found that the neighbors were home. They might as well been in our bed because we could hear them as if they were in the same room. I went down and to discuss our situation with the front desk and they gave us a room change. They said it was a suite, but after getting to our loft room, I found that the only thing that made it suite was that the room was on the top floor and bigger.
